executive_summary: Over the past five years, online large kitchen appliance sales operators benefited from steady growth, as both rising e-commerce sales and rebounding construction activity boosted demand for operator goods. Sales of major appliances rely heavily on activity within the housing market, a trend that positively boosted operators as growth in housing starts and remodeling activity spiked during COVID-19. A further shift toward e-commerce kept revenue growth steady throughout the entirety of the five-year period. These trends caused revenue to grow at a CAGR of 12.3% to an estimated $13.2 billion, including an estimated 0.4% slip in 2023, as high inflation dampens discretionary consumer activity.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Online large kitchen appliance sales operators have benefited from revenue growing at a CAGR of 12.3% to an estimated $13.2 billion, including an expected 0.4% slip in 2023, when the profit margin is poised to reach 3.8%.

Government incentives, such as consumer rebates on the Energy Star-qualified appliances, helped spur further demand over the past five years. The growing popularity of Wi-Fi-enabled "smart appliances" has also driven sales forward, as rising consumer confidence drives more high-value purchases. Operators have also increasingly invested in marketing to attract more customers, including offering free-shipping and installation.

Over the next five years, revenue is forecast to continue its upward trend, growing at a CAGR of 3.4% to an estimated $15.6 billion. These trends are expected to encourage more brick-and-mortar establishments to engage in online activities, thereby attracting new companies to the market.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Economic recovery and housing market growth
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Strong growth in housing starts during COVID-19 helped accelerate the scope of the residential housing market, while providing operators with a larger marketplace where large kitchen appliances are regularly installed. Consumers also gained interest in home improvement projects, as exemplified by the strong growth in private spending on home improvements over the past five years, which garnered newfound interest in procuring larger kitchen appliances in a more convenient manner.

A key development in recent years has been the accelerated adoption of online shopping via electronic devices, smartphones and computers, as consumers look to streamline their shopping process. Consistent growth in e-commerce sales, coupled with steady adoption of computers among households, has provided consumers with more access points to digital shopping and makes it easier to compare, research and acquire large kitchen appliances.

The wave of technological advancement has not only influenced consumers' shopping habits, but also boosted the quality and multi-faceted technical capabilities of the products themselves. Kitchen appliances, such as refrigerators, have gained noteworthy upgrades as "smart appliances", which now include Wi-Fi enabled support, energy efficiency and touch screen capabilities that make it easier to use for the consumer.

Online large kitchen appliance sales operators are expected to endure revenue growing at a CAGR of 3.4% to an estimated $15.6 billion over the next five years, with the profit margin poised to reach 3.4%.

industry_definition: Operators in this industry sell major household appliances, such as household cooking appliances, laundry equipment, refrigerators, upright and chest freezers, dishwashers, water heaters and garbage disposal units, via the internet.

negative_impact_factors: Low - Steady Barriers To Entry Level

key_trends: Steady rise of housing market influenced higher demand for operators' services
Higher rate of e-commerce activity among customers boosts online sales of kitchen appliances
Upgrades in appliance efficiency bolster home valuation
Steady growth of the housing market is poised to create consistent revenue stream for operators
Innovation of product stream set to bolster value of operators' products
Improvisation of online shopping experience set to support e-commerce traffic
The shift toward e-commerce is also expected to make the existing competitive environment more intense

market_segmentation.segment_description: This market segment generates revenue among consumers between the ages of 45 to 64.
This market segment generates revenue among consumers aged 25 to 44.
This market segment generates revenue among consumers aged 65 and older.
This market segment generates revenue among consumers aged 25 and younger.

products_and_services.product_description: This product segment generates revenue via sales of household refrigerators and freezers.
This product segment generates revenue via sales of laundry equipment, such as washing and drying machines.
This product segment generates revenue from the sales of cooking appliances, such as electric ranges, indoor and outdoor ovens and surface-cooking units.
This product segment generates revenue from other appliance sales, such as water heaters, dishwashers, trash compactors and garbage disposals.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Appliance purchases are often determined by price, as most consumers are price conscious. The price charged by operators significantly affects demand for new appliances.

international_trade_points.trade_description: Domestic operators in this industry supply the domestic and international market through online websites.

business_locations.location_description: Operators prioritize areas with higher populations and favorable geographic locations.
Online sales of large kitchen appliances are highly popular in the Southeast.
Many online operators benefit from close proximity to storage facilities.
Most demand for online large kitchen appliance sales in this region is fueled by a booming corporate sector.
The Southwest has been a growing location for many operators.
These areas lack significant population centers and have considerably less warehouse facilities.

regulations_points.regulation_title: STREAMLINED SALES AND USE TAX AGREEMENT
regulations_points.regulation_description: This regulation created the framework for placing sales taxes on fully online operators.

regulations_points.regulation_title: KITCHEN APPLIANCE SHIPPING REGULATIONS AND STANDARDS
regulations_points.regulation_description: Operators must also ensure they meet the latest shipping guidelines.

basis_points.basis_description: Online shoppers are mostly looking for bargains, so companies that can offer low prices will likely experience an increase in sales.
An operator's reputation in this industry has a significant impact on repeat buyers.
Most external competition is limited to brick-and-mortar department stores and big-box retailers.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Prevalence of Name-Brand Stores Strengthens Concentration
concentration_points.concentration_description: Operators that have recognizable branding and marketing campaigns benefit from significant leverage.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Localized Appeal for Large Kitchen Appliances Provides Variety of Opportunities
concentration_points.concentration_description: Smaller operators continue to secure a consistent share of the market.
More mid-sized retailers will look to enter the marketplace due to the low operating costs associated with online sales.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Large Costs of Appliance Insurance Exacerbate
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: The acceleration of insurance costs amid high inflation has heightened broader administrative expenses for operators.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Operators endure a low level of capital intensity.
Over the past five years, capital intensity has remained consistent.

volatility_points.volatility_title: High Inflationary Pressures Limit Consumer Propensity
volatility_points.volatility_description: Despite the popularity of online shopping, consumers' disposable incomes took a hit.

volatility_points.volatility_title: CONTINUED ADOPTION OF E-COMMERCE MAINTAINS HIGH
volatility_points.volatility_description: As more consumers adopt e-commerce, it expands the market.
With a significant shift in shopping habits, more customers enjoy the ease of using online stores.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Technology is crucial to the success of operators.
Enhancements in online marketing capabilities are essential.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in one corner of the market or do you retail a diversified range of products?
FAQs.answer: Companies specialize in large kitchen appliances.

FAQs.question: Are your company's sales heavily dependent on the health of the US economy?
FAQs.answer: Sales are heavily dependent on disposable income and the housing market.

FAQs.question: Do you contract directly with manufacturers in order to reduce purchase costs?
FAQs.answer: Corporations benefit from vertical integration and cutting costs.

FAQs.question: Has your company explored acquisition opportunities in order to expand reach and reduce overhead expenses?
FAQs.answer: Companies benefit from acquiring smaller companies.

FAQs.question: How has your company reacted to the rise of online sales over the past few years?
FAQs.answer: Operators benefit greatly from the rise of online sales.

FAQs.question: How does your company utilize new technology in its operations?
FAQs.answer: New developments in social media and mobile apps are increasingly allowing industry players to reach customers.

FAQs.question: Have any regulatory expenses significantly impacted profitability recently?
FAQs.answer: Legislation affecting tax collection poses a threat to companies.

FAQs.question: What does your company do to remain compliant with new consumer regulations?
FAQs.answer: Companies work with trade associations to stay updated.

FAQs.question: How does your company's inventory turnover compare to major competitors'?
FAQs.answer: Large kitchen appliances do not need to be replaced frequently.

FAQs.question: How do your company's profit margins compare to your main competitors'?
FAQs.answer: Larger companies benefit from economies of scale.

FAQs.question: How much emphasis is put on after-sales service? What are the associated costs? What is the rate of repeat customers?
FAQs.answer: Operators that provide superior after-sales service can attract repeat business.

FAQs.question: How can you improve your company to receive better word-of-mouth recommendations?
FAQs.answer: Having a good reputation is important due to competition.

FAQs.question: How quickly can new technology be adopted? Does your company keep up to date with the latest technology?
FAQs.answer: Operators must continually update their business to keep pace with technology.

FAQs.question: Access To Credit
FAQs.answer: Many consumers choose to purchase using credit.

FAQs.question: Per Capita Disposable Income
FAQs.answer: Per capita disposable income is a strong determinant of demand.

FAQs.question: Housing Starts
FAQs.answer: Demand for new large kitchen appliances increases with more homes built.
